intro: Selliguea yakuinsularis, commonly known as the Yaku Island moss, is a species of liverwort found in specific regions of Japan. It belongs to the family Pottiaceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form. The plant typically grows on rocky substrates, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually small, densely arranged, and exhibit a distinct midrib. Selliguea yakuinsularis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity.
